page.title: 19My Nan
page.content: When I talked to my nan she told me about my Great Grandfather.Harry Cowley was a Brighton chimney sweep who became a legend in his lifetime fighting for the poor and homeless. My nan's family were poor and ate mainly stew,bread and dripping.One Christmas they only had boiled potatoes for dinner.There was no Christmas tree only paper chains. Nan often tells me about Harry Cowley's funeral.Hundreds of people attended and many more watched at home as it was televised.It was held at St Peters Church where he laid in state overnight.The procession passed through Upper Gardner Street where my Great Grandfather and Mother had a market stall.He would be there every Saturday in his bowler hat and bow tie. When my Grandmother visits it brings back memories of the 'Guvnor'.
